description: Initial page load displays map centered on Chicagoland area with latest snowfall data
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the ChiSnow homepage
Step 2: Verify page loads within 2 seconds
Step 3: Verify map is centered on Chicago (approximately lat: 41.8781, lon: -87.6298)
Step 4: Verify snowfall data is visible on the map
Step 5: Verify heatmap layer is displayed by default
Step 6: Verify markers are displayed by default
Step 7: Verify storm selector shows most recent storm
Step 8: Verify no error messages are displayed
Step 9: Verify loading states complete successfully
Step 10: Verify map is interactive (can pan and zoom)

description: API route /api/snowfall/latest returns correct data format
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/snowfall/latest
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify response contains stormId field
Step 4: Verify response contains date field in ISO format
Step 5: Verify response contains measurements array
Step 6: Verify each measurement has lat, lon, amount, source, station, timestamp fields
Step 7: Verify source field is one of: NOAA_NWS, NOAA_GRIDDED, or COCORAHS

description: API route /api/storms returns list of recent storms
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/storms
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify response is an array
Step 4: Verify array contains 5-10 storm objects
Step 5: Verify each storm has id, date, totalStations, maxSnowfall fields
Step 6: Verify storms are ordered by date (most recent first)

description: API route /api/snowfall/[stormId] returns specific storm data
steps: Step 1: Get a valid stormId from /api/storms
Step 2: Make GET request to /api/snowfall/[stormId]
Step 3: Verify response status is 200
Step 4: Verify response matches the same format as /api/snowfall/latest
Step 5: Verify stormId in response matches requested stormId

description: API routes implement 2-hour caching to reduce external API calls
steps: Step 1: Make first request to /api/snowfall/latest
Step 2: Record response time
Step 3: Make second request to /api/snowfall/latest within 2 hours
Step 4: Verify second request is faster (cached)
Step 5: Verify response data is identical
Step 6: Wait 2+ hours and make third request
Step 7: Verify cache has expired and fresh data is fetched
